projects: [{"title":"Financial decision making under information asymmetry","start_date":"Mar 2017","end_date":"Present","description":"Aimed at studying the impact of information on decision making of individuals• Designed an Excel VBA based real-time dynamic game that offered several different financial choices for the participants• The choices available in the game were proxies for real-life scenarios such job decision, investments, loans and business opportunities• Analyzed the results that displayed that group with information availability outperformed the other by a margin of 40%• Displayed that the absolute best choice wasn't made despite availability of complete information"},{},{"title":"What explains trading volume better","start_date":"Jun 2016","end_date":"Nov 2016","description":"Sponsored by: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd• Analysed the dynamics of stock price returns and trading volume in a time series-cross sectional model of Nifty 50 market • Employed trading volume as investor sentiment proxy to derive a pricing kernel or risk factor to capture the underlying investor sentiment • Analysed the past 7 years' Nifty 50 to understand if such a behavioural/stochastic pricing kernel/risk factor empirically explains (expected) stock returns • Established trading volume equation through linear & fractal analysis capturing investor sentiment via macro & micro-economic factors • The relation established captures 60% of motion of trading volume of a stock with the remainder offset error value at an standard deviation of 6%"},{},{},{"title":"Rural Development Live Project","start_date":"Mar 2016","end_date":"Apr 2016","description":"• Addressed 'Infrastructure & Sanitation'; was awarded best live project by Rural Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur among the 15 participating groups • Designed resource-optimization strategies for implementation, solving the subject issue along with related problems of Employment and Logistics"},{}]
